title: What’s a smartphone made of? - Kim Preshoff

multiple-choice.question: As of 2018, there are approximately how many smartphone users in the world?
If we were to break open all the newest smartphones and split them into their component parts, how much gold would be produced?
What are the two most critical groups of chemical elements that make up the average smartphone?

options.label: A
options.text: Rare earth elements and organic compounds

options.label: B
options.text: Precious metals and rare earth elements

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary method of extracting rare earth elements from the earth, and what are some of the environmental impacts associated with it?

options.label: A
options.text: Open pit mining, causing air and water pollution, habitat destruction

multiple-choice.question: What are some of the social problems associated with mining for the ingredients used in smartphones?

options.label: A
options.text: Large-scale human and animal displacement, poor working conditions for laborers

options.label: B
options.text: Habitat destruction, air and water pollution

multiple-choice.question: What is the main driver of climate change associated with smartphone production?
What is the predicted number of smartphones in use by 2019?
What are some of the options for minimizing waste when getting rid of an old phone?

options.label: A
options.text: Donate it to a charity, take it to an e-waste recycling facility, or look for a company that refurbishes old models

options.label: B
options.text: Sell it online, trade it in for a new phone, or recycle it for cash

options.label: C
options.text: Bury it in the backyard, throw it in the trash, or give it to a friend

multiple-choice.question: What are some of the problems associated with e-waste recycling facilities?

options.label: A
options.text: Intentional exportation of e-waste to countries with poor working conditions, underpaid laborers, and exposure to toxic chemicals

options.label: B
options.text: Lack of effective recycling methods, resulting in the release of toxic chemicals into the environment

options.label: C
options.text: Environmental and social impacts similar to those of mining for the ingredients used in smartphones

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the fact that a phone is an assemblage of elements from multiple countries, linked to impacts unfolding on a global scale?

options.label: A
options.text: It highlights the importance of recycling and reducing waste

options.label: B
options.text: It emphasizes the need for sustainable smartphone production

options.label: C
options.text: It illustrates the interconnectedness of global supply chains and their environmental and social impacts

title: Why cockroaches are so hard to kill

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated number of species of cockroaches that live on the planet?
How many species of cockroaches have adapted to live around humans?
What is the scientific name of the species of cockroach discussed in the transcript?

options.label: D
options.text: Periplaneta Americana (officially known as the American Cockroach)

multiple-choice.question: Where did the American cockroach originally come from?

options.label: D
options.text: The American cockroach originated in Africa

multiple-choice.question: How many olfactory receptors for smell does the American cockroach have?
How many gustatory receptors for taste does the American cockroach have?
What type of genes are associated with the American cockroach's ability to smell and taste its environment?
What is the function of the genes called Cytochrome P450s in the American cockroach?

options.label: D
options.text: To help the American cockroach withstand poisonous chemicals

multiple-choice.question: How long can an American cockroach survive without its head?
What is the key to keeping American cockroaches clear of your kitchen?

options.label: C
options.text: Storing food in airtight containers, covering trash bins, and keeping your basement dry

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the American cockroach's diverse diet?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes it hard to find food

options.label: B
options.text: It makes it easy to find a meal just about anywhere

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the detoxification enzymes in the American cockroach?

options.label: C
options.text: To protect the cockroach from harmful substances

multiple-choice.question: How long can the American cockroach regrow lost limbs?
What is the key to keeping cockroaches from climbing up from sewers into your bathroom sink?

options.label: C
options.text: Plugging holes in your walls, unused electrical outlets, and especially drains

multiple-choice.question: What is a unique characteristic of the American cockroach's immune system?

options.label: D
options.text: It seeks out and kills harmful microbes and fungi

multiple-choice.question: What is the American cockroach's regenerative ability?

options.label: A
options.text: It can only regrow its head

options.label: B
options.text: It can regrow lost limbs and even its eyes

options.label: C
options.text: It can only regrow its antennae

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason why the American cockroach is a master survivor?

options.label: C
options.text: Its ability to withstand poisonous chemicals

title: Could the Earth be swallowed by a black hole? - Fabio Pacucci

options.label: C

title: Is height all in your genes?

options.label: A
options.text: Human height has always remained the same over the centuries.

options.label: B
options.text: Human height has had its ups and downs over the centuries.

options.label: C
options.text: Human height is only determined by genetics.

options.label: D
options.text: Human height is only determined by environment.

options.label: D
options.text: They experienced a significant decrease in height

Which scientist conducted a large-scale, systematic study of height in the early 19th century?

options.label: A
options.text: Parents' heights often predicted the heights of their kids.

options.label: B
options.text: The heights of siblings were much closer.

options.label: C
options.text: Height was only determined by genetics.

options.label: D
options.text: The heights of siblings were much closer, but parents' heights did not predict the heights of their kids.

options.label: B
options.text: How genes and environments influence human attributes, but not how much.

options.label: C
options.text: How much genetic carbon copies end up differing.

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: The reason was due to the lack of access to clean water.

options.label: C
options.text: The reason was due to the change in diet and environment.

options.label: D
options.text: The reason was due to the lack of access to healthcare.

multiple-choice.question: What is the term used to describe the idea that nearly all of our genes influence human traits, including height?

multiple-choice.question: What is the concept of social justice, according to the speaker?

options.text: It's the idea that justice is only relevant in certain parts of the world.

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: Teaching is a neutral act that only involves imparting knowledge.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's argument for why schools should be places where students are allowed to practice making a difference?

options.label: A
options.text: Schools should be places where students are only allowed to learn certain subjects.

options.label: B
options.text: Schools should be places where students are only allowed to learn through traditional methods.

options.label: C
options.text: Schools should be places where students are allowed to practice making a difference and changing the world.

options.label: D
options.text: Schools should be places where students are only allowed to focus on their own interests.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's argument for why verbs are more important than nouns in education?

options.label: A
options.text: Verbs are only relevant in certain situations, and nouns are more important.

options.label: B
options.text: Verbs are more important because they are active and require constant engagement.

options.label: C
options.text: Verbs are only relevant in certain subjects, and nouns are more important.

options.label: D
options.text: Verbs are only relevant in certain parts of the world, and nouns are more important.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's argument for why schools should be places where students are encouraged to think critically about the world around them?

options.label: A
options.text: Schools should be places where students are forced to sit silently and passively receive knowledge.

options.label: B
options.text: Schools should be places where students are encouraged to think critically about the world around them and question injustice.

options.label: C
options.text: Schools should be places where students are only allowed to learn certain subjects.

options.label: D
options.text: Schools should be places where students are only allowed to learn through traditional methods.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what percentage of incoming college freshmen in 2015 said they would participate in a protest sometime during their college career?
What is the speaker's argument for why social justice matters to students?

options.label: A
options.text: Social justice only matters to students who are interested in politics.

options.label: B
options.text: Social justice matters to students because it helps them build skills like leadership and critical thinking.

options.label: C
options.text: Social justice matters to students because it helps them understand history and its ongoing impact on current events.

options.label: D
options.text: Social justice only matters to students who are interested in activism.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's argument for why teachers should be thought partners with students?

options.label: A
options.text: Teachers should only be authority figures who impart knowledge to students.

options.label: B
options.text: Teachers should be thought partners with students and help them grapple with complex ideas.

options.label: C
options.text: Teachers should only be involved in traditional teaching methods.

options.label: D
options.text: Teachers should only be involved in grading and assessment.

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the relationship between love and justice?

options.label: A
options.text: Love and justice are unrelated concepts.

options.label: B
options.text: Love is what justice looks like in public.

options.label: C
options.text: Love and justice are mutually exclusive.

options.label: D
options.text: Love and justice are only relevant in certain situations.

title: What really happened to the Library of Alexandria? - Elizabeth Cox

multiple-choice.question: Who is credited with setting out to fulfill one of humanity's most audacious goals: to collect all the knowledge in the world under one roof?

options.label: A
options.text: To create new copies for the library to keep and send the originals back to the ships

options.label: B
options.text: To keep the originals and send the copies back to the ships

options.label: C
options.text: To send the originals back to the ships

options.text: Within a few hundred miles of its actual size

What was the reason for the murder of the mathematician Hypatia in 415 CE?

options.label: A
options.text: For studying the library's ancient Greek texts, which were considered blasphemous

options.label: C

title: The most extreme births in the animal kingdom

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the way kiwi birds give birth?

options.label: B
options.text: Females lay a single egg up to 20% of their body weight.

options.label: C
options.text: They have a very short gestation period.

options.label: D
options.text: They give birth to fully quilled chicks.

multiple-choice.question: Which species of lizard has a particularly difficult pregnancy?
What is special about the birth canal of a spotted hyena?

options.label: C
options.text: Females have phallic-like genitalia, which can rip apart during childbirth.

options.label: D
options.text: It is only used for giving birth.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the spider that has a particularly extreme way of caring for its young?

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: The joeys are born with their ears open.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge that joeys face when they are born?

options.label: A
options.text: They have to find food on their own.

options.label: B
options.text: They have to crawl from the mother's birth canal, over her body, and into her pouch.

options.label: C
options.text: They have to compete with other joeys for milk.

options.label: D
options.text: They have to adapt to a new environment.

options.text: Because the mother has only four nipples.

options.label: B
options.text: Because the joeys have to compete for milk.

options.label: C
options.text: Because the joeys have to crawl from the mother's birth canal, over her body, and into her pouch.

options.label: D
options.text: Because the joeys have to adapt to a new environment.

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is a unique characteristic of porcupines?

options.label: C
options.text: They are born with their eyes open.

options.label: D
options.text: They are born with their ears open.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge that porcupettes face when they are born?

options.label: A
options.text: They have to find food on their own.

options.label: B
options.text: They have to crawl from the mother's birth canal, over her body, and into her pouch.

options.label: C
options.text: They have to compete with other joeys for milk.

options.label: D

title: How feng shui shaped Hong Kong's skyline

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the ancient Chinese practice affecting the skyline of Hong Kong?
According to the transcript, why do buildings in Hong Kong have holes in them?

options.label: D
options.text: To allow dragons to fly through, as part of the practice of Feng Shui

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the building that was designed to fend off bad luck as it's coming through the hole in the bottom?
What is the name of the good energy out there floating around, good luck, good fortune called?
What happens if you don't arrange your physical environment in an optimal way according to Feng Shui?
According to the transcript, what was the reason for the bad luck surrounding the Bank of China building?

options.label: B
options.text: The materials used in the building

options.label: D
options.text: The sharp angles of the design, which cut the good Qi

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the building that was designed to combat all of the bad luck that's coming from the Bank of China building?

options.label: D
options.text: HSBC building, with its maintenance cranes

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the practice that was preserved in Hong Kong during the Cultural Revolution?

What is the name of the building that people freaked out about because it kind of looked like a candle or like a smoking cigarette?
